topics.title: Bene Platform Introduction and Core Mechanics
topics.summary: Introduction to Bene, a proof of funding platform that enables projects to raise funds and automatically distribute contribution accounting tokens. Explanation of how project owners create funding vaults with goals, deadlines, and token distribution rates, and how contributors receive proof of funding token vouchers.

topics.title: Bene Success and Failure Scenarios
topics.summary: Visual explanation and real-world examples of how Bene works, including successful Gluon Gold fundraising and hypothetical scenarios. Demonstrates both positive outcomes when goals are met and protective mechanisms when projects fail or are fraudulent.

topics.title: Bene Use Cases and Applications
topics.summary: Overview of various applications for Bene including donations, crowdfunding, startup funding, event tickets, and collaborative projects. Emphasizes the original benefaction use case where both labor and capital contributions are rewarded equally.

topics.title: Bene Implementation and Live Demo
topics.summary: Presentation of Bene's web implementation on Ergo blockchain, including the landing page, GitHub repositories, and a complete live demonstration of creating a project and making contributions. Shows the browser-only approach using observers connecting directly to Ergo blockchain.
